website_summaries.verdict: These bars are small and backpacker-friendly.
pros: While each 200-calorie bar is around the size of a fig bar, they're surprisingly filling
They have a pleasant coconut taste
cons: Bars are susceptible to crumbling, be careful when opening

customer_reviews.title: Two Years Old on Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: The bars that I got today, June 2019, were manufactured in May 2017, leaving less than tree years left on the shelf life. Getting only 3/5 of the shelf life earns only three out of five stars.
customer_reviews.author: L. Laubenheimer

customer_reviews.title: they are still good and taste the same
customer_reviews.text: I bought these emergency rations back in 2013 and kept them in a compartment of my car as part of my go bag. They have endured both extreme heat and freezing temperatures. I am in the process of rotating out these rations because they will be approaching their expiration date soon. I can say that after sitting in my car for four years, they are still good and taste the same. I highly recommend these for any one needing small portion rations that last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.  Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great deal. All were still sealed on arrival. They taste pretty good. Each bar is individually wrapped, recommend using a knife to cut the plastic wrap and slide the bar out. If you try to tear with fingers or bite the wrapping with your teeth the bar will crumble. You can eat half the bar with a sip of water, then repeat. If you try and eat the entire bar at once with no water your mouth will dry out and it will be hard to swallow it. Overall.. I think these are great to have just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Check the expiration date!!
customer_reviews.text: These are supposed to have a 5 year shelf life but the pack I received was already over 2 years old...I’m pretty disappointed and will not buy again!! If it were even within the first year of production it wouldn’t be such a big deal!!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for its intended use
customer_reviews.text: Flavorless? Yes Stiff packaging? Yes I didn’t buy this for the flavor or it’s beautiful packaging. I bought this as last resort meal supplement. I also use this as meal replacement which is much better than what you can get at your big box brick and mortar.
customer_reviews.author: Synmastic Pizza

customer_reviews.title: I should have read the details better
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to experiment with cheap emergency supplies of food. When I read this I read "2400 calories and 12 bars" I didn't see that it was 2400 calories total so that's 200 calories per bar. That is barely enough calories in all 12 bars for 2 days for 1 person. For 20 dollars I was better off buying 2 MREs with 1800 calories each and a full meal. On the plus side it lasts 5 years and is small and easy to pack but nutritional value when compared to a military MRE, no contest.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Can find double the size for the same price elsewhere. The "12 bars" are tiny.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: I guess if you were lost in the wilderness it would be perfect, otherwise I would forget this one
customer_reviews.text: Hmmm, the taste reminds me of saw dust. I was looking for something high in calories. The way they market it is very misleading. There are several bars in a package, it sounds as if each bar had the state's amount of calories, but no. You would have to eat the whole package . I guess if you were lost in the wilderness it would be perfect, otherwise I would forget this one
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne G.

customer_reviews.title: Throw some hot sauce on ‘em, they’re fine
customer_reviews.text: Not the tastiest 2400 calorie emergency food ration bars for disaster survival you’ll find but certainly not the worst. Slather these babies in A-1 or perhaps a tangy pepper jack sauce and they’re fine. Worst case, better than a can of dirt in an apocalyptic situation. Can only eat so many freeze dried dinners I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: El Duderino

customer_reviews.title: It's better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: These do not taste very good. They're not terrible, don't get me wrong. I've had worse food at pot lucks. These are basically shortbread cookies. The container has 12 individually wrapped 200 calorie shortbread cookies with very little nutritional value. They're emergency food, they don't really need to be more than enough to keep you from dying when nothing else is available, and they do that! I think these are pretty average. Very similar to Mainstay. Millennium bars are superior and just as shelf and temperature stable. Tastes are pretty subjective though. In my opinion if you want to know for sure you should buy small versions all of the options and try them all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Blair

customer_reviews.title: Boat rations made into awesome desk rations. Keep in truck, in home, etc.
customer_reviews.text: So, I know these are supposed to be for survival, but they're friggin good. I've got one brick stowed in my truck, two at home, and one at work where if I missed a meal or I'm just feeling a little peckish, I'll crack one open and down it. They taste like a clean cookie. Like a macaroon sorta. If I didn't know they were 200 kcals each, I'd probably eat a whole brick at once. I have a friend who swears by these as sustenance if he's got a stomach bug. Makes sense. Burned through the first brick pretty fast... will have to order some more soon.
customer_reviews.author: BearCub

customer_reviews.title: Short Expiration Date
customer_reviews.text: 12 tiny bars in one pkg. Just received these, mfg 12/17, exp 12/22. Lost 1.5 yrs on what's supposed to be a 5 yr exp date. Will keep these since I have no others, but will order different brand/supplier next time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Violette

customer_reviews.title: "Well, you can live on it, but it tastes like..."
customer_reviews.text: So I bought these for a purpose. They serve that purpose splendidly. I bought these to serve as emergency rations in the car, in case we ever got stuck someplace for an extended period of time. I used to just carry peanut butter crackers, but my kid discovered the stash and that was the end of that. These are packed with nutrients and calories and they taste just bad enough that I know the child won't get into them unless it's a bona ride emergency. In essence, they are perfect. They lose one star because I think they could have done the nutrients just a little bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya Maree

customer_reviews.title: Helps us be prepared....
customer_reviews.text: We always have Datrex items in our Emergency Supply....the taste is better than anywhere else and the calories per unit are concentrated enough to carry in a disaster setting. Not cheap, but worth the extra cash. Always our first choice for BugOut bags and Jeep Survival Camping Kits!
customer_reviews.author: Beekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Good quantity.
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t try it I hope I don’t have to. I like that they come individually wrapped. One did have a small rip in the bag, no biggie to me. I had the same issue as one of the other reviews, my lifespan on the bag that I got is 3 years instead of 5 because it was made 2 years ago, not that big of deal to me but it does state 5 years so I could understand people being upset about that so I dropped a star for that reason. I’m gonna keep it in my bugout bag just incase.
customer_reviews.author: CoolBreeze

customer_reviews.title: Already 2 years gone on shelf life
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for an Eagle project because we needed bars that had a 5 year shelf life, which these were advertised to have a 5 year shelf life. What they didn’t tell us was they were produced in 2017 so 2 years of the shelf life had already gone by. Very disappointing. They expire in 2022. Not 2024
customer_reviews.author: Lee Lee

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: These are pleasant-tasting enough, but dry and crumbly. Advertised as not thirst-promoting, but the bars are dry enough that I'd want some water to wash them down. Also, the internal bars are individually-wrapped; the wrapping is OK for a day or two, I'd guess, but unlike the outer foil wrapper, not going to cut it for long-term storage. So once you crack the outer foil package, plan to eat the whole thing within a week or so.
customer_reviews.author: Art Majors

customer_reviews.title: Emergency backpack
customer_reviews.text: Is a great product, stay good, soft cookie, taste like coconut.
customer_reviews.author: Maricusa

customer_reviews.title: Survival food that never survied shipping
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these and one came in with the vacuum seal broken. When I tried to get a replacement for the damaged one, I found out that it was not offered. Only returns and reorders allow for this product. Stay away form this product and its distributor. No way to contact the original seller. Bad news for anyone buying this product. Amazon will probably delete this feedback. I'll bet you twenty bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Already Old Product
customer_reviews.text: These bars are supposed to be good for five years, but the ones I received expire in 2022, only three years away. Old product. Very disappointed and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again from this seller!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this product came as expected with adequate packaging. There was no damage to the product. I have not tasted it so I will give the benefit of the doubt from the majority of other reviews that’s it’s not bad tasting. The date of product is consistent to the 5 year expiration that the website claims. I would gladly recommend from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: CPTMarvelComix

customer_reviews.title: A good non-milk survival option
customer_reviews.text: One of the very few non-milk survival rations. I can't eat milk, so this is a huge boon. For a description of the product, think compressed crackers. It's like crumbs forced into a bar with as little oil as possible. Taste is fine and cost is comparable to similar "snacks" of equal calories. I suspect it's health value is similar to potato chips without as much grease. In a survival situation, you'd be glad you had these. These are awesome snacks, too. Each individual bar is individually wrapped and can be taken on bicycle trips with ease. No refrigeration, good shelf/pack life.
customer_reviews.author: Pax

customer_reviews.title: The tast is like a chalky apple or coconut cookie
customer_reviews.text: Bought a package for an event at work. Each bar is about twice the size of a granola bar in every dimension and wrapped in cellophane. There are two cellophane wrapped bars in each foil wrap and the resemble a brick. The foil wrapped in a larger "case" delivered in a standard card board box. The box arrived a bit smaller than I expected. The tast is like a chalky apple or coconut cookie. Everything about this purchase was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Susan JD

customer_reviews.title: Good ration bars
customer_reviews.text: Flavor isnt bad but very crumbly. Will be good for emergency situation if ever needed though. I like that they are all individuqlly wrapped also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great emergency backup food source.
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be a far better option in a starvation situation than eating human flesh which has been proven to happen in many cases worldwide. They are contingency food with a decent shelf life. Maybe the world will improve and what is now imminent will subside; but I doubt it.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Leggett

customer_reviews.title: Tastes great too
customer_reviews.text: These things are freakin delicious. The packaging doesnt have the nutritional info that some of my others have, but they are downright tasty. Slight hint of coconut in the flavor, quite filling and energy boosting. The nutri info may have been on some of the paperwork or something, I'm not sure. I do know that Ive eaten a full package of them and had no unpleasant results, only energy and a full belly. 12 Bars in each vacuum pack with 200 calories in each bar. The bars are nice and small and each is individually wrapped in thin plastic that doesnt easily tear. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Skwurl

customer_reviews.title: Not going to get 5 years
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in good shape but is dated 12/17. On the first day I lost 30% of the five year shelf life. I would have liked to receive something produced more recently.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Survival crumbs cookies bars
customer_reviews.text: This things are great I use mine for camping I don't bring much food or reduces what you carry I hunt or fish my food but this is nice back up to have cause u don't get lucky or catch something to eat every time, some time you want to go so far or make camp at the place you like that, you simply have no time for it. Inside the package they come in 200 cal individually packaged bars. The bars brake up pretty easy, I cut the top of the 200cal bar and eat it like that without taking it completely out, other wise u may end up eating crumbs out of your hand and they taste ok.
customer_reviews.author: Pepelepiu

customer_reviews.title: It's food... not much else
customer_reviews.text: Planning on having food survive a nuclear/zombie/alien/kaiju apocalypse? This is pretty much what you're looking for. Condensed bars made from coconut it's... well... it's food. I wouldn't recommend eating them without water, and with how condensed they are you should MOST CERTAINLY eat only small bites at a time lest you get choked on them. Only really bad thing is that they crumble easily and the individual wrapping for the bars is pretty flimsy. The individual bars are NOT sealed like the main package so you can't open one up just to try it without exposing all the bars inside.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Okapi

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t seem properly sealed
customer_reviews.text: Product was not tightly vacuum sealed as I expected. Am not sure if it is even any good or not. This is not the type of product you open and test. This is the type of product you stock away for emergencies. I will not open it and essentially waste my Money- but I do not think it is supposed to be packaged this way.
customer_reviews.author: MetalGoat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with two year old survival food.
customer_reviews.text: This item has a mfg date of 12/17 with a five year shelf life. Item is already two years old. Extremely disappointed with this supplier. A replacement will more than likely be just as old. Thought I was buying new product from manufacturer. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: evangeline barnes

customer_reviews.title: Yum
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe I was driving around with coconut shortbread cookies in the back of my car for 5 years and never knew it. After they expired I opened the package to see—and taste— what was really in there. They were individually wrapped, filling, and very nice with coffee. A bit crumbly yes, but because of the fat content not actually dry. I happily reordered.
customer_reviews.author: Sapote

customer_reviews.title: does expired for 2025
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried so can't give a five-star but giving the high rating because the expiration date is 2025. Very well package.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment...
customer_reviews.text: This is one time I'm very disappointed with a product from amazon.com. Not your fault I don't think. These are so dry and tasteless. The are so dry that it made me thirsty for two glasses of water...no joke. Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: H. Busch

customer_reviews.title: Emergency food
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for our survival to go bags in emergency. So haven't tried it. They are really compact like small bricks. I imagine I'll need lots of water just to chew it and get it down.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy B.

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied, but I haven't eaten them yet
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to put under the car seat, and that's where they've been for the last couple of months. Vacuum packaging is sturdy and still intact. The production date was within a few months of receipt, so full lifespan should be expected. Price was competitive. I can't say much more, because I've yet to try to eat them. However, no matter how good or bad they do or don't taste in an emergency I think that they'll be far better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: sixtharmy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: The taste wasn’t bad at all ,nice to have in your truck or back pack for emergencies
customer_reviews.author: Adam Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Haven't tasted this, of course. Its going in ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tasted this, of course. Its going in my emergency kit, so I just want it to last a long time and provide calories if I need them.
customer_reviews.author: LuckyLALady

customer_reviews.title: DATREX Food Ration Bars
customer_reviews.text: May someday come in handy if TEOTWAWKI ever hits the fan
customer_reviews.author: fox

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I fully expected this stuff to taste like cardboard and it actually wasnt that bad. If you are hungry and need calories etc, you are likely not going to whine about having something to eat. Thats why I bought several packages of these and placed them in with my emergency food supply. Not a bad price for what you get, they are compact (easily fitting in a backpack) and light enough weight so as to not throw off the overall weight of a bag out bag etc
customer_reviews.author: Tim Schrage

customer_reviews.title: Misleading photos
customer_reviews.text: Seller should post a photo of only the ONE package of 12 bars that are being purchased. The four photos is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: I think they're good.
customer_reviews.text: Can't say anything about the flavor as I'm putting them in my go bags. They appear to be in good shape and the Mylar shrink wrap looks secure.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Lewis

customer_reviews.title: i like the fact that it has such a long life expectancy.
customer_reviews.text: They were put into my bob(bug out bags) so I have not opened them yet, let's be honest I would eat tree bark if needed in that situation, so I'm not to concerned with the taste, but I know to eat one bar every 6 hours to stay nourished. They have their uses. I like the fact that there is about 3 days worth of food in just the bars alone, they are sealed tight, and from what I see no air, so they will last long. They take up very little space.
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Haraburda

customer_reviews.title: Great for kits!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little guy so I could put it in my backpack for work (I am a game warden so I spend a lot of time in the wilderness). It doesn't take up much room so it is a good emergency ration to compliment the other food items I carry (usually an MRE or just some granola bars.) Not sure how it tastes... but honestly, if I am in a situation where I am having to eat this, I doubt I will care much what it tastes like (better than insects and leaves I bet!)
customer_reviews.author: Wincal356

customer_reviews.title: food
customer_reviews.text: TASTS GOOD BUT A LITTLE DRY AS PKG STATES UNDER DIRECTIONS./ THIS IS FOR MY EDC.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Years old. Half the sself life.
customer_reviews.text: The product was years old. Cut the shelf life in half. Otherwise it's fine. Go with S.O.S bars if you want full shelf life.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Manufacture date already 2 years old.
customer_reviews.text: Have not tried product but was not pleased with the 1917 manufacture date. Lost 2 years off shelf life on delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Old Badger

customer_reviews.title: It's...a survival ration
customer_reviews.text: I've had all the brands, Mainstay, mayday, SOS and this.... I'd get something else...it's not BAD but....considering the density of the others and flavor...I'd go with SOS...the others are basically sugared up pie crust condensed with multi vitamins. These are like.....compared to the others "light scones" you can see the almond bits in the mix which is kind of nice..but the taste is a lighter and ...like I said in density...you don't feel as full afterwards considering the others. NOT saying they are bad for what they are.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Bad Packaging
customer_reviews.text: Of the ten individual packages I received, only 6 were vacuum sealed. The other 4 had pinholes, apparently from the interior packaging, and had lost the seal. I can't speak for the quality of the product itself, but the packaging, at least, is inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Will M.

customer_reviews.title: although two of the waters had already burst in the packaging out of 66 or 64 isn't bad. But I haven't tasted the product
customer_reviews.text: I finally received the packages do to high demand. I can said it was worth the wait, although two of the waters had already burst in the packaging out of 66 or 64 isn't bad. But I haven't tasted the product. It is strictly for emergency !!
customer_reviews.author: Beauty

customer_reviews.title: Okay. fair for this price
customer_reviews.text: It taste okay. as expected, Its super dry. And that is kinda a problem cuz its turns to powder easily when u try to open up the wrappers. maybe not compressed enough??? One thing i like is the size. easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Kiru

customer_reviews.title: A semi-poor choice for survival
customer_reviews.text: These are designed for people stranded at sea in a life raft who have very little physical activity while waiting for rescue. These are NOT intended for a situation that requires lots of physical activity, and are NOT recommended for long term survival as they do not supply adequate nutrients, proteins, or fats required for energy for people who are active, and more than likely, actively trying to survive or pursue rescue.
customer_reviews.author: ian

customer_reviews.title: Good to have in a pinch-
customer_reviews.text: Better to have and not need than need and not have.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Datrex Emergency Survival 2400 Calorie Food Bars
customer_reviews.text: Great for preppers! Always nice to have a stash of emergency food. These are just like coconut flavored candy bars that can sit around for years. I'm not a big prepper, but this is an item that won't break the bank and will keep you alive for a few weeks if the S.H.T.F. and it came down to survival.
customer_reviews.author: Ynotm8

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: They arrived sooner than expected and were well packed, and not expired. They are a little on the dry side, I have to drink something while eating them. They are quite edable but I can't see living on them. They are good for those of us that need extra calories. I think they are on the dry side but others may not agree with that. But worth what I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Had a problem......the company had a solution.
customer_reviews.text: I had an issue with the vacuum seal being broken on the food I ordered. The company made good on the order and replaced the broken goods.......recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: travis

customer_reviews.title: You can eat it and you won't starve but I ...
customer_reviews.text: You can eat it and you won't starve but I don't think you will tip the waiter/waitress, well . unless you are starving at the time.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Hope I never need to use them in a real emergency situation but they sure are nice to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: JiiiRwall

customer_reviews.title: Not tasty, but will keep you alive.
customer_reviews.text: If you like coconut, then you never will again after living on a deserted island for a few years with nothing but these and coconuts. But hey, you'll be alive to tell your story. As long as you eat 3 or 4 of these a day.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great taste and better than what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my BOB and went hiking. Broke these open and I was very happy. As all of the other reviews mention, it does taste a lot of coconut. To me, that is awesome. It's like eating a cookie. It is a little sandy and gritty, but one you chew it your saliva re-hydrates it and each piece ends up being bigger than what you think. Even one cookie felt like it could hold me over for a few hours without issue. I just put in another 2 orders for these last night.
customer_reviews.author: B. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Fooled by picture
customer_reviews.text: My bad, but I thought the bags would be larger...next time read the description.
customer_reviews.author: H. Dentist

customer_reviews.title: Fast arrival and intact
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't had to (thank gosh) break into these they were priced right and arrived fast and intact. They are super hard (lets hope you have good incisors after the SHTF to knaw on them) but let's face it- they are emergency food and need to pack tons of calories into a small and long lasting form.
customer_reviews.author: DivaMommy

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Havent actually ate any but the packaging is sturdy wont worry about it bursting while on the move
customer_reviews.author: Andrew ha

customer_reviews.title: Choices are wonderful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought and sampled SOS and ER. I've used Datrex for years and never compared it before. SOS is ok. ER I really prefer now.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Guddy

customer_reviews.title: Its pretty flaky once opened
customer_reviews.text: Its pretty flaky once opened. The taste is not bad. I am keeping it in my cars emergency bag, and am thinking that the kids wont eat all of this with out me knowing like other things I have tried to store like jerky, etc.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shelf stable emergency food option
customer_reviews.text: Tastes kind of like graham cracker powder. It's not gourmet, but that's not gonna happen with this kind of calorie density and shelf stability/durability.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Datrex 2400 Bars Yes!!
customer_reviews.text: This bar is larger than you would think as it is made up of multiple bars within one sealed unit. I got a great deal on these, better than the 3600 calorie units by far and am not so concerned with taste, so I have not opened them yet. This is perfect accompiniement for a BOB or a cars trunk whichever - Thanks great product and deal
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Elms

customer_reviews.title: No problems here!
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived on time and all the individual packages were sealed. They are compacted and light weight enough to fit in our emergency packs, I have not tried then yet, but hey,when it is an emergency is taste really going to matter that much?
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Early
customer_reviews.text: Arrived early, I haven't tried it but it appears to be standard life-raft rations with an expiration date of 2022. I happy with it, It will go in my bag in trunk to get me home if I get stuck and have to walk/stay overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't expecting much
customer_reviews.text: I got these as a back up for camping and hiking (just in case we couldn't catch any fish) and they were a lifesaver. Probably moreso than we know. The flavor is surprisingly good and they held fresh 3 months prior to our trip. Outstanding product, two thumbs way up
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A.

customer_reviews.title: Just in Case!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these as emergengy food only. I have not tried these and hope to never "need them" I placed one in each vehicle and in my BOB's. Some 2400 and some 3600 calorie bars. The plan is to trial them and order more before they expire. My order was placed in September of 2012 and the manufacture date on these were 01-12 with an expiration date of 01-17. So, it was about 8 months old into a 5 year shelf life. Would have liked for a more recent date on them, but for around $2 a year, per vehicle/BOB it is still worth my money to have emergency food.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading other reviews I decided to take a chance with these hoping that the company would be working to increase their quality control. Looks like a no since one of mine came with a bad seal. Take your money to a company with higher standards.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Teeny, teeny tiny bars!
customer_reviews.text: Teeny, tiny bars! It looked like ONE bar, it is so small! Can’t believe these are 2000 calories!! All 12 measure 3 x 3.5 x 2 approximately: FOR ALL 12!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol L

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful When Opening!!!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints on the product itself, just a warning. I used a small knife to open the box it was shipped in and cut into the rations, breaking the vacuum seal. At least, it gave me a chance to taste the cookies. Not bad, slight coconut flavored cookie, each wrapped in clear plastic. Mine was manufactured in May 2011, got them in August so only a few months old, will re-order.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Vacuum seal broken
customer_reviews.text: One of the 4 packets arrived with its vacuum seal broken.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: survival?
customer_reviews.text: Received my order of 2400 cal.ration bars vacume seal was good on all 3 packs . . if your looking for empty calories with little nutrition these bars are perfect . I assumed being survival food they would have a little more nutrition . For what these bars cost you can do a lot better with other alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: michael williams

customer_reviews.title: Hard to Swallow
customer_reviews.text: Nice coconut flavor, individually wrapped, but break up into about a million pieces when you open the wrapper. They seems to expand in your mouth while chewing, and become a glob the consistency of web sawdust, which makes it necessary to drink water in order to swallow it down. They would be a perfect alternative to using graham crackers to make a pie crust.
customer_reviews.author: FritzJ

customer_reviews.title: Watch How the Cookie Crumbles
customer_reviews.text: Taste OK. A very light sweet bland taste. I actually kind of like the taste. Tested one after 3 years. It crumbles easy and you have to open the plastic wrapper very carefully or you'll have crumbs!
customer_reviews.author: Nom De Plume

customer_reviews.title: They come apart very easy.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for an emergency but they are to dry for my taste...make sure you drink plenty of water and be careful​ they come apart real easy.
customer_reviews.author: M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good item last forever seems like. replace my stock every 5yrs, if kids don't eat them all up.
customer_reviews.author: trader

customer_reviews.title: Check expiration date.
customer_reviews.text: The product has a shelf life of 5 years. When I received my order it was already two years old.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Bohn

customer_reviews.title: Datrex 2400
customer_reviews.text: I like it because each package has 3 days worth of food and each portion is wrapped individually so you will not waste any food. I heard these are not the best tasting but who cares when you are hungry and have no other sorce of food. I could really care less if they crumble. I can eat crumbs! This is the best place I have found for the price. I like more bang or your buck and this is the place to get them. Just make sure who you are buying from. I did a lot of research before I bought these. Hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Bad Taste
customer_reviews.text: OK option for food storage. For someone else. I couldn't stand the taste of this stuff and so will not be buying it. It made me thirsty to eat this and water isn't something that will be plentiful if I'm ever forced to eat this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: never tried it. for emergency use only. 5 years life span.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: TOOOO Expensive for what you get. Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Gmtidwell

customer_reviews.title: Great for your emergency bag
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't taste to bad and is sealed up tight to keep it fresh longer. Great for the emergency bag or for extended camping trips. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Fremin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item for the SHTF department
customer_reviews.text: Tastes great, and very well packaged. Only problem is that the 'cookies' are somewhat crumbly; by the time you get the packaging off, they're in pieces. All in all we're adding them to the SHTF boxes/packs/kits.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Craig

customer_reviews.title: I bought a 10 pack and each arrived sealed. ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 10 pack and each arrived sealed. All the dates on them were only 2 months old so I still have 5 years before I need to replace them. Im going to bring them camping to try them taste wise once it warms up.
customer_reviews.author: Liberta

customer_reviews.title: Hard to open but worth stocking.
customer_reviews.text: The only real complaint I could have about these bars is that the individual wrappers are so difficult to open that the corners of the bars tend to crumble when you open them. Other than that they taste good and are not bulky for the level of nutrition they contain.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very dry and crumbles easily. Bars are individually wrapped, which is nice. Not my favorite
customer_reviews.author: A.George

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived in perfect condition and has a long expiration date
customer_reviews.text: Decent size block of compacted survival food. Quite heavy actually. Product arrived in perfect condition and has a long expiration date. Will put it in my survival pack.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S.

customer_reviews.title: Received with full shelf life!!!
customer_reviews.text: Based on others reviews I was nervous when I saw this order was fulfilled by 123 Closeout. My order was manufactured 3 months ago and has almot a full 5 years shelf life!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M.

customer_reviews.title: Expiration date
customer_reviews.text: These are advertised as having a 5 year shelf life, however, my package has an expiration date of 12/22. That's only 3 years left. Not very happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Taste is acceptable if not great. All as expected
customer_reviews.text: Tried one. A bit crumbly. Saving the rest for an emergency. Taste is acceptable if not great. All as expected.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Ivers

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. Wish I could get a sample piece ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Wish I could get a sample piece to taste though.
customer_reviews.author: NICHOLAS GUILLEN

customer_reviews.title: Compact, good taste and long life
customer_reviews.text: These are great. I have them in my car get home bag. They are vacuum sealed into a brick about the size of your fist and taste good for what it is. Perfect for long term storage and calories if the situation arises.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Too dry
customer_reviews.text: Super dry. If I eat this out in the woods while doing a bug-out I'll need a gallon of water to choke it down. Yuk.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Brian K. Miller

customer_reviews.title: There not bad you don't want to put them out for for ...
customer_reviews.text: There not bad you don't want to put them out for for your supper bowl party I have mine in the glovebox in my jeep just in case
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact size.  Haven't tasted it.
customer_reviews.text: I like the compact size of this emergency bar, it fits nicely in my bag. The wrapper appears to be very durable and it's expiration date isn't for a few years. Overall, I'm pleased with this purchase and hope I don't have to use it! I can't speak for the taste because I haven't tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Katt978

customer_reviews.title: Great price great product!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Always have extra food and water on hand in case of an emergency!
customer_reviews.author: TheMan

product_meta.title: DATREX Emergency Food Ration Bars for Disaster or Survival, 2400 Calories per Pack of 12 Bars
feature_bullets: Value Pack of 10 12 bar packs, Total of 120 bars with 200 Calories per bar, 2400 Calories per pack
Tabletized and sub packaged for ease of rationing and storage in your survival and disaster kit
All natural ingredients with no preservatives and superior coconut flavor
USCG, Canadian Coast Guard, EC and NZ approvals; 5 year shelf life (NSN 8970 0154 7777 6)
High energy value; ready to eat; non thirst provoking
